p: DNA damage has been seen in the form of oxidative DNA damage, DNA strands break, and mutations occur. Such alterations in DNA are related to numerous chronic diseases. Fragmentation of DNA base will yield several products, containing 8-hydroxyguanine (8-OHdG), thymine glycol, adenine, and hydroxyl methyl urea [ 99]. 8-OHdG is an altered nucleoside base, which is the most commonly detected by-product of DNA damage in many diseases such as cancer and diabetes and has been suggested as a sensitive biomarker for assessing oxidative stress level in diabetic patients [ 100, 101].
